meanings.definition: An object with a series of parallel bars or slits, typically used for covering an opening or as a barrier.
meanings.sent1: The metal grating over the drain prevented debris from clogging it.
meanings.sent2: The cat walked across the grating on the sidewalk without any trouble.
meanings.sent3: The grating on the window made the house look like a fortress.
meanings.sent4: The grating of the elevator doors closing echoed through the lobby.
meanings.sent5: The grating on the bridge was so rusted that it creaked underfoot.

meanings.definition: Irritating or annoying in manner or sound.
meanings.sent1: Her grating voice made it hard to concentrate on the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The grating noise of the construction work next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent3: His grating laughter could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent4: The grating sound of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent5: The grating squeak of the old swing set brought back childhood memories.
